title: How bulldozers became a vehicle of injustice in India
description: Critics say India's ruling government is using bulldozers to intimidate the minority Muslim community.

title: Mountain gorillas: The ripple effect of conservation
description: Justin Rowlatt finds out what gorilla conservation can teach us about protecting other species.

title: Global inflation: Five ways US rate rise will affect you
description: The impact of higher interest rates in the US will cascade through the global economy.

title: A social media murder: Olly’s story
description: What role did social media play in the murder of 13-year-old Olly Stephens?

title: 'People used to make fun of my scarring'
description: Chrissie Riedhofer has spent most of her life learning to cope with people staring at her.

title: Ukraine war: Band members reunite after fleeing invasion
description: The four members used to speak mostly Russian but now say they cannot use the language of their oppressors.

title: French National Assembly vote decides battle between Macron and left
description: President Emmanuel Macron fights a crunch parliamentary election against a green-left alliance.

title: Rail strikes: Not for government to intervene - Shapps
description: But union leaders blame politicians for failing to stop rail strikes which will begin on Tuesday.

title: Calvin Ramsay: Liverpool sign Aberdeen right-back for £4.2m
description: Liverpool have completed the signing of 18-year-old Scottish right-back Calvin Ramsay from Aberdeen on a five-year deal for an initial £4.2m.

title: US Open: Matthew Fitzpatrick shares lead after day three
description: Watch highlights as England's Matthew Fitzpatrick scores a two-under 68 on day three of the US Open to tie for the lead with American Will Zalatoris.

title: Spectacular pink and orange sunset lights up sky
description: Saturday night's incredible colours had people reaching for their cameras across the UK.

title: Brexit: Plans to ditch parts of NI Protocol are economic vandalism - Irish PM
description: The UK government has published plans to get rid of parts of the post-Brexit deal it agreed with the EU.

title: Manchester United chief executive Richard Arnold heads off protest as he meets fans in pub
description: Manchester United chief executive Richard Arnold headed off a planned protest outside his Cheshire house by meeting some fans in his local pub.

title: Ukraine war could last for years, warns Nato chief
description: Jens Stoltenberg says the costs of war are high but the price of letting Moscow win is even greater.

title: Finsbury Park terror attack: 'Dad was happy 24/7'
description: On 19 June 2017, Ruzina Akhtar's dad Makram Ali was killed by a man who drove into a group worshippers.

title: Apple store workers vote to form first US union
description: The move by employees in Towson, Maryland, is the latest in a string of high-profile union campaigns in the US.

title: US Open leader Matt Fitzpatrick says US Amateur win at Brookline in 2013 is helping this week
description: Matt Fitzpatrick says winning the US Amateur at Brookline in 2013 will give him "an edge" as he chases his first major at the Boston course on Sunday.

title: Duke of Cambridge: New photo of Prince William to mark Father's Day
description: The photo of the duke grinning with his children on holiday is released just before his 40th birthday.
